page.title: 05 THE BREWING INDUSTRY
page.content: There are two breweries in Faversham. Whitbread and Shepherd Neame. Approximately 150 people work at each today,compared to 600 in the past.This drop is due to improved technology.The hops are picked at farms like Queens Court and Brenley and processed at the brewery.Lorries are now used instead of drays,wooden barrels have given way to aluminium kegs. The Golding and Wye Challenger hops are made into five varieties of barrel beer and seven of bottled beer.The production of beer has increased by 50% to 156,000 barrels a year. Water is pumped from a 200' well,the original artesian bore.The automatic bottling line can wash,fill,cap and crate more than 14,000 bottles an hour,however this automation has cost many jobs traditionally done by women.
